column5: SAILORS WARNING  Ya what ever,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   When I got to my spot at 4:45 am, I was greeted with this.I could though, see what was coming way out there. Tops of the trees were just starting to flick thier leaves.    Then by 6am, I was in this.    Then by 7 am, I said uncle. 1/5-2 ft rollers.    I wasnt worried about any danger to myself, as the toon is great in this stuff. It,was my legs, They were getting tired of staying on spots. They were none stop flipping just to keep from being twisted and turned.  Few fish were caught on spinner baits and lost a tank that spit the bait as I was just about to grab the net.   I just rode the rollers in. Free ride.LOL  Sunday does not look any better, but if theres an opening, I,ll be back at it.  BASS SEASON IS NOW HERE.  So I guess the ole saying is true, but I was never a sailor..
Did you get to piggy back any smallies Brian?  Beats my morning. Weeded by veggie garden and changed the oil in my tiller.  Nice shots. Thx for sharing.
Did you get to piggy back any smallies Brian?    If I had of, Im sure I wouldnt of gotten back on the toon Steve. LOL
Up here Sturgeon has just a ripple, winds are calm, a slight whisp of cloud in the sky but that is it! it's now 1:45 pm. Course we pay more taxes in the Kawarthas!
Trees are still flipping back and forth here.  Taxes. Dang, I forgot to pay mine. LOL
Few fish were caught on spinner baits and lost a tank that spit the bait as I was just about to grab the net.   Just consider it as a 'remote release'

Few fish were caught on spinner baits and lost a tank that spit the bait as I was just about to grab the net.   Just consider it as a 'remote release'   I no longer use trailer hooks. It gets off, it gets off. I guess he,s not happy to be fooled and stung, but happy to swim away. Im happy he wanted to play.LOL  When I got to the water this morning, all fish were safe. It was a wild one out there.
